bill_title: prohibit the state from contracting for services to be provided by persons outside the United States or persons not authorized to work in the United States.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the state from contracting for services to be provided by persons outside the United States or persons not authorized to work in the United States. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 5-23 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Bureau of Administration and any other state agency may not enter into any contract for the purchase of services unless the contract provides that only citizens of the United States and persons authorized to work in the United States pursuant to federal law may be employed in performance of services under the contract or any subcontract awarded under the contract. No such contract may be awarded for services to be rendered by a contractor or subcontractor from a site that is outside the United States. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
